title: square facetted sans w/ flourishes and ligatures
content:
Hi all,

I've been looking for different ligatures for a school project and found this typeface...I just can't seem to figure out what it is, but I think it looks very elegant, subtle yet contemporary.

These examples are designed by Red Design for Gresham Blake (you can see the full photo on their website [http://www.red-design.co.uk/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014000935/http:/www.red-design.co.uk/ "http://www.red-design.co.uk/") - still - gresham blake).

Did Red Design make this themselves or is it an exsisting typeface?  
if it is an exsisting one, would anyone know the name of it and where I could buy it?

thank you very much!

grtz,  
dav2.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [love honour6.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014000935/http:/typophile.com/files/love%20honour6.jpg) | 17.61 KB |
| [love honour1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014000935/http:/typophile.com/files/love%20honour1.jpg) | 20.21 KB |
| [love honour5.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014000935/http:/typophile.com/files/love%20honour5.jpg) | 17.91 KB |
author: skeetone

comments.content: This reminds me of [Lingua](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014000935/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/lingua/characterset.html) but it's different.

makes me think of this [http://www.mmparis.com/bjorkasabook/011.JPG;](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014000935/http:/www.mmparis.com/bjorkasabook/011.JPG; "http://www.mmparis.com/bjorkasabook/011.JPG;") although the m/m font is IMO more refined and beautifull

thank you very much for your quick replies!

So it could be that the changed the lingua a little bit for their own needs? Or would you think it's an exsisting font still?

It's quite hard to see the details of the bjork book. I think I'll just send an email to Red Design, they should be able to tell me, right?
Yes, they could probably tell you.
